faq.title: Common questions
faq.q1: Does it work without the internet?
faq.a1: Yes. Your emergency card is stored locally and can be displayed and spoken offline.
faq.a2: We do not track you. Your data is encrypted and stays on your device unless you choose to share it.
faq.a3: Absolutely — a simple scan opens your card; big text + audio highlight the critical details.

about.metaDesc: ANERITA is a patient‑first emergency ID that shows and speaks your critical info — even offline.
about.title: About ANERITA
about.lede: ANERITA is a patient‑first emergency identification system that shows — and speaks — the essentials when seconds matter. It works online or offline, in any country.
about.missionText: Help responders act faster and safer by giving them clear, consent‑driven information — allergies, conditions, meds, and care preferences — in seconds, in their language.
about.why_clarity_html: Clarity in chaos: emergency decisions are made fast. We surface what’s critical first.
about.why_privacy_html: Privacy by design: your data lives on your device unless you choose to share it.
about.why_global_html: Global by default: big text + voice + translations to bridge language barriers.
about.safety_device_html: On‑device first: emergency card works offline; optional cloud features later.
about.safety_tracking_html: Zero tracking: no analytics cookies; privacy‑friendly telemetry only when you opt‑in.
about.safety_consent_html: Consent & control: you decide what shows on scan, and who sees what.
about.safety_note: Compliance roadmap: UK GDPR baseline; HIPAA alignment for any U.S. hosting/integrations; ISO 27001 practices as we scale.
about.trustText: ANERITA follows GDPR (Europe) and HIPAA (US) principles. Your data never leaves your device unless you choose to share it. No trackers, no ads, no third‑party data mining.
about.onDeviceText: Unlike cloud‑only apps, ANERITA works offline and caches securely. This ensures responders can access your critical info even without signal.
about.fromPatientText: ANERITA was created by a patient who experienced how hard it is to be heard during emergencies. This tool exists so your voice and wishes are clear when you can’t speak.

clinician.title: Clinician & responder information
clinician.lede: ANERITA is a patient‑owned emergency card that displays and speaks time‑critical information at the scene — even without signal.
clinician.col1_text: Scan the QR code on the patient’s tag/phone, or tap the widget. The card opens instantly; tap Play to hear the voice summary.
clinician.col2_list1: Identifiers (name, DOB), allergies, key conditions, medications.
clinician.col2_list2: ICE contacts (In Case of Emergency) and patient notes.
clinician.col2_list3: Language/translation aid and triage color indicator selected by the user.
clinician.col3_text: The emergency card is cached on the device. If there’s no network, the screen and voice still work. No login required at scene.
clinician.verifyText_html: The card is patient‑supplied information. If clinical risk is high or details conflict, verify against secondary sources (wristband labels, medication boxes, GP records, Summary Care Record, EHR, or next‑of‑kin).
clinician.verifyBul1: Last updated: shown on the card.
clinician.verifyBul2: Cross‑check: scan tag + confirm name/DOB with patient or ICE contact when possible.
clinician.privacyBul1: No trackers. Data is stored on the patient’s device; sharing happens only when they or a guardian present the card.
clinician.privacyBul2: Use for direct care in emergencies under standard consent exceptions where applicable.
clinician.privacyBul3: Do not photograph the card unless local policy allows and it is necessary for care.
clinician.disclaimer: ANERITA is an information aid, not a medical record. Clinical judgment remains paramount.
clinician.docBul1: That a patient‑provided emergency card was consulted (ANERITA).
clinician.docBul2: Key items used (e.g., allergies, do‑not‑use meds, warnings).
